params._to: The new owner of this contract

constructor.details: The constructor simply calls the Ownable constructor to store the owner which is the creator of this contract

createUser(bytes32).details: If the sender has not already a User contract, stores inside users a new User contract, and then updates the map userAddresses to connect sender-User

params._name: the username of the user willing to subscribe

deleteUser(address).details: This function removes from the storage the User contract and then removes from the map of addresses the attached User contract. The User contract is still alive, its destruction depends on its owner

params._user: The address of the User contract to remove

getUsers().details: Returning here a User[] would involve a loop cycle to cast address=>User
getUsers().return: The list of stored Users contracts

params._user: Contract User to check the presence

userCount().return: The number of stored User contracts

changeOwner(address).notice: This function provides the possibility to change the owner

getMyUserContract().notice: Get the User contract attached to the sender

getUsers().notice: Get the list of the addresses of stored User contracts

isIn(address).notice: Check if a User contract is present

userCount().notice: Get the number of stored User contracts in this System

userdoc.notice: This contract is the top stack actor, it interfaces with the users providing methods to insert/remove users
